creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: very large dark brown jar with irregular, bulbous shape; short neck, rounded lip; tan, beige, and gray drip glaze top one-third of body; drips down mouth interior; large stoneware globules on sides
medium: Tokoname ware; stoneware with natural ash glaze
text: A light-colored glaze descends from the wide neck and covers the sloping shoulders of this storage jar from the Tokoname kilns. Named for the town of Tokoname on the Chita Peninsula south of Nagoya, Tokoname ware has been produced since the eleventh century at a number of kilns in the vicinity of the town. The high iron content of Tokoname clay leads to a characteristic dark, red-brown surface.
title: Storage jar
